APNG is a file format which extends the PNG specs to permit animated images that work similar to animated GIF files, while supporting 24-bit images and 8-bit transparency not available for GIFs.
AVIF is an image file format spec for storing images or image sequences compressed with AV1 in the HEIF container format.
lossless data compression algorithm which uses a combination of LZ77 lossless compression algorithm, Huffman coding and 2nd order context modelling.
Brunsli works as a transcoder converting between JPEG and JPEG XL.
LJPEG is a mode of operation of JPEG. This mode exists because the discrete cosine transform (DCT) based form cannot guarantee that encoder input would exactly match decoder output.
MozJPEG improves JPEG compression efficiency achieving higher visual quality and smaller file sizes at the same time and compatible with the JPEG standard
PNG is a raster-graphics file format that supports lossless data compression and supports palette-based images, grayscale images, and full-color non-palette-based RGB or RGBA images.
QOI is a specification for lossless image compression of 24-bit or 32-bit color raster (bitmapped) images.
Rcomp codec is an implementation of the Rice algorithm
Codec to convert numpy array to PNG image and vice versa.
Codec to convert numpy array to TIFF image and vice versa.
Codec to convert numpy array to WebP image.
Codec to Compress Zlib format using Zopfli.
Codec to convert numpy array to AVIF image.
